runs.comm: length ball on the stumps, Dilshan rocks back and swats it over backward square leg for a boundary first ball
tosses this up a bit higher, Dilshan sweeps hard across the line again, this is a huge top edge but it lands safely 20 yards back behind the keeper as two fielders give chase
flat and on middle and off, Kusal defends watchfully back to the bowler
tapped into the off side coming forwards
Root pushes this through, sliding towards leg stump and Kusal sweeps four more, hard through backward square for the second boundary of the over
on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
starts on a length outside off and Dilshan tries to scoop him immediately, flicks and misses as the ball flies through to Buttler
more orthodox swashbuckling from Dilshan this time, sits back and carves a short ball wide of third man for another boundary
slightly back of a length and outside the line of off, chops one more through gully
angled over the top of the stumps, Kusal stays back and defends
there's the first six, comes flying off the top edge as Kusal whirls across the line, total miscue but it flies over slip and all the way
Woakes plugs away on a length in the channel, this time Kusal swings and misses
goes for the Dilscoop again and this time gets it away, just enough on the flick to clear the keeper
over the wicket to the right-hander, Dilshan skips down the track, swings hard but unsuccessfully
slightly short of a length, plays this watchfully with a straight bat

oh, got him, clipping the top of off! Initially looked like Dilshan had edged behind, trying to drive on the up and got slightly cramped for room - maybe just nibbled away from him a touch. Good bowling and that's Gurney's first wicket in an England shirt
lefty to lefty now, Vithanage shuffles across and blocks around off
length delivery in the corridor outside off, Vithanage is dreaming of Hove - where he smashed five sixes - as he aims a big woolly woof down the ground and misses completely
pushed across the left-handed Kusal, who steers into the covers
sits back in the crease and opens the shoulders, picks out point

Kusal goes, flicking straight to short fine leg - Bopara didn't have to move! Jordan picks up Sri Lanka's other opener, this was a shortish leg-stump delivery that probably should have got the treatment but instead Kusal slapped it to the man on the edge of the ring and slopes off. At least he's ended his run of single-figure scores, I suppose
length delivery outside off, Thirimanne runs it off the face to third man
touch short, on the stumps and blocked
picked up and that's going down town! Slightly overpitched from Jordan, in the sweet slot for the batsman, who bunts it towards long-on, not quite all the way
length ball around off, squirts one towards backward point
not quite short enough for the pull and Vithanage aggressively miscues to mid-on along the ground
length ball, seaming in a fraction as Vithanage goes across his stumps and heaves to leg, flicks his body on its way through to the keeper
clears the front leg and has another hack, inside edges one through backward square leg
good length on off stump, Thirimanne pushes gently square on the off side - another dot for Gurney
length in the channel, the batsman makes a little more room and scythes a cut straight to backward point
bit of width and Vithanage throws the hands, the ball flies off the top edge but there is no third man, so a safe option, picks up four more
goes fuller, outside the line of off and driven with a flourish, really got hold of that but a diving stop at extra cover keeps them to one
back of a length, on the pads, Thirimanne works a couple through the midwicket region
ooh, that's super timing from Thirimanne, leg-stump line from Jordan and clipped behind square, beats the dive of Hales on the boundary rope
slides this across the batsman, who thick-edges a single to third man
fired in full and fast, Vithanage drops the bat on it in time
round the wicket, comes forward and dabs a single into the off side
reverses the hands, swipes hard across the line and the ball sails over backward point, smartly done from Vithanage
nurdles a couple thorugh midwicket, Jordan's throw is decent but the batsman gets home at the bowler's end
pushed square on the off side and they pinch one more
drags his length down a touch, punched back past the bowler to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, leans on a dab through midwicket for one more
around the wicket, starts with a back-of-the-hand slower ball, grips a touch and beats the bat as Vithanage aims a thump down the ground
slightly short from Bopara, takes the top edge but there's plenty on it to divert the ball past Buttler for four
length outside off, just a tad too much room and cut firmly behind point, no third man and that's another boundary
beautifully played, lovely wrists from Vithanage, an even later, more delicate cut gets four more to third man
slides down the leg side - called wide but was it a stumping chance? Tough grab for Buttler and Vithanage's feet were very quickly back in the crease... but if you don't take 'em, you'll never know
very full, digs it out down the ground for one
angled towards leg stump and clipped off the pads through square for one
pushed through outside off, goes back and cuts one behind square
another reversey Percy from Vithanage, comes off the top edge and just clears the fielder at point! He's rattling along, is the new man. Kumar and Mahela who?
tossed up on middle and leg, worked behind square
flatter delivery, nudged off the pads for another single on the leg side
floated up full and straight, driven hard into the ground but straight to short extra cover
flat trajectory outside off, chopped of the back foot through point
back of a length on leg stump, nudged back and the single is declined, Thirimanne has to scramble back at the non-striker's end
pitched up this time, manages to dig one out short on the leg side
low full toss, slapped to backward point and it's dropped, bursts through the hands as Jordan got down to it. Went really quickly, he shakes his hands - bit of a stinger on a night like this
uppercuts, over the ring but not far enough to clear the ropes, Carberry comes in off the boundary for a simple take! Dug in short and struck a little too cleanly, sailed all the way to the fielder
short ball, Chandimal doesn't see it properly and nearly gets in a tangle as he thrusts his gloves at the ball
fuller, outside off, punches one into the covers to get off the mark
clean slog sweep and clears deep midwicket into the stands
fuller ball, just ran to midwicket

goes for the slog sweep again and gets this wrong, it's gone up and not long enough and Hales takes the catch a solid take running in a little from long-on, a second excellent strike for England. That was a little wider, more off stump from Root and had to be fetched more
back foot punch to short midwicket
delayed action, back foot again, finds short midwicket again
more leg stump line, flicked to short long leg and they scamper a single
full on off stump, driven at awkwardly and gets a thick edge to backward point
more solid stroke back to the bowler, don't think it carried, Woakes parried it and they took a cheeky single
back of a length flicked down the leg side, not enough on it to beat Gurney running round at long leg
just back of a length and Mathews jumps back in the crease and just blocks around middle
shorter and pulled, not a lot on this again and Gurney can cut it off easily at long leg
excellent yorker on leg stump and just dug out back to the bowler
tossed up just outside off, flicked back to the bowler
touch shorter length and finds the bowler again coming forward
waited for a little more and works it wide of Tredwell and down to long-on
around the wicket, played from off stump to point for an easy single
firmly swung down to long-on where Hales does enough to save two
tossed up on the stumps, swung over the leg side and nails it into the stand, big hit over that part of the ground but that was well struck
full, dabbed into midwicket, no-one at home so Bopara gives chase and saves two
full and wide, played out to deep cover
slower ball on off stump, dabbed through midwicket and they charge for two but Jordan steams in and saves well
full length and enough width to swing the arms, solid timing over extra-cover and just avoids Carberry charging around the rope, good placement
dropped calmly down to long-on off the back-foot
wristily worked down to long-on from the crease
full on the stumps, flicked through forward square leg, just a single
gives himself an awful lot of room outside leg, goes to cut and gets a thin outside edge that skips away from short third man
over the wicket now, played through square leg and this time they will get two into the deep with excellent running
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket, they take on Morgan for a single and a direct hit at the bowler's end would have seen a run-out
gets low in the crease and heaves this over long-on, right old club and finds the stands

down the track, goes downtown again but this time doesn't time it and picks out long-off. He was aiming leg side again but this squirted to the off side and didn't have the carry to evade long-off who didn't have to move
full on the stumps, worked into the leg side, gets back short midwicket and they get a single
back of a length on leg stump, swung away but straight to long leg
length ball slapped from the crease down the ground, one bounce to long-on running to his right, just a single again
full and wide, reached for and gets a thick outside edge that has enough pace to evade third man, little unlucky for Woakes that
nothing unlucky about this though, length on middle and leg and it's picked up into the stands, big hit clearing the front leg
full on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
full and wide, reached out for and driven to extra cover
full and wider this time, the batsman can't reach it but no wide given, he did move to leg a little
full toss wide of off stump, slapped to backward point and Tredwell can't hold on to what would have been a blinding one-handed catch diving to his right, good save in the end
full and wide again, reached for an a bottom edge runs into the covers for just a single
somewhat a half-volley just outside off, swung hard at and gets a whirl of an edge short of deep cover
full again, two feet wide of off stump but too good for the batsman, 91 mph too, excellent over

low full toss, slower at 68mph, swung to leg but a terrible connection off the bottom of the bat and flies it straight to deep-midwicket. A total miscue, deceived by the lack of pace, and holes out at a poor time just when Sri Lanka were looking for a kick
another slower ball, 70mph, but Perera is onto this and slaps it hard as nails down the ground for a flat one-bounce four inside long-off

another slower ball, another total miscue, chipped straight up in the air into the covers, in come Carberry and Morgan, it's Carberry's catch but he's shelled it eee-ooorrreeee. That's a dolly. Morgan rather got in his way
full on the stumps, dug out into midwicket and it's just a single
full and wide of off stump, a wild swing and not for the first time in this innings, an outside edge goes for four to third man
low full toss, slapped without timing down to long-on
full and wide, just inside the guidelines, a Tim Southee special, batsman misses
ANOTHER thin edge to third man! A wild swing gets a whirl off an outside edge and it's fine of the deep fielder
both straight men are up so down the ground is the stroke and that's where Perera goes, swinging a full ball over long-off, Jordan slightly missing his length
he's missed his length badly here, waist-high full toss and it's panned into the crowd behind long-on
four more, wide full toss and Perera nails it over extra cover
another big swing and gets this wide of long-on, has this hit the boundary for six? Not quite, third umpire says four
dab into the leg side and a single gets Perera back on strike
just a single down to long-off, that was straight to the fielder and hard so no wiggle room
slower ball a foot wide of off stump, swung at and, yep you've guessed it, a thick outside edge to third man, fielder up in the circle has no chance
full toss on the stumps, swung down to long-on and they come back for an easy second on a fumble from Root
fuller length, slapped out to deep midwicket

nailed back to the bowler, it clatters the stumps at the bowler's end, they run but Gurney is aware, grabs the ball, runs to the wicket and yanks out the stump to run out Perera and deny him what would have been the fastest half-century by a Sri Lankan in T20
